posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
The key is a good seasoning and making Bouletten instead. My recipe:
500 g half pork half beef mince
3 slices of sandwich bread thrown in a blender
1 large egg
1 finely diced medium or large onion
14 g salt
2 g black pepper
1 g white pepper
1 g mace
1 g ginger
0.5 g cardamom
0.5 g allspice
0.3 g coriander
2 g paprika
A handfull chopped parsley
Maybe also a garlic clove

Just knead everything together until it binds well, turn it into 100 g balls and fry them in clarified butter or oil.

You should already know breadcrumbs and egg are in all meatloaf recipes. I use 1 egg per 2 lbs of meat, and about a cup or so of breadcrumbs.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
To get the most of your chicken you really have to marinade it. Now there's a lot of confusion as to how best marinade a chicken and even if it achieves anything at all as it can have little penetrability in the carcass, as in how far inside the meat the flavor gets

This confusion is caused mostly because people are entirely focused on the wrong point. Which marinade you choose won't make or break your chicken. The secret lies deeper.

It actually depends on the involucrum, where you marinade your bird. Most people use bowls or plastic bags and wonder at their chicken tasting bland or not as powerfully as they desired. Well, no wonder! The real chefs and a select few foodies actually know where to store a chicken in this most delicate of times. And now I'll blow the lid on it and tell you all, because flavor is meant to be shared. You see, you're supposed to imbibe the marinade onto your own self, performing the most ritualistic of enemas, and once you're good and flavored up, you can then and only then proceed to cram that bird right up in there, letting it rest for no less than 24hours before birthing it onto a roasting pan
Mwah! Perfect everytime!

Pale ale =/= IPA
Pale ales are usually fairly hoppy, but the hops are added during the boiling process of brewing. IPA's generally have more hops than a regular pale ale added during the boil, as well as even more hops added after fermentation has slowed down which is called "dry-hopping."

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
As a private citizen, you are generally permitted to import food items from Iran for personal consumption as long as they are not subject to any specific prohibitions or restrictions and they are not intended for resale. However, you should be aware that there may be additional restrictions or regulations that apply depending on the specific food item and the way it is imported.

Another option would be to look for Iranian restaurants or grocery stores that operate legally in the US, many of them can provide traditional Iranian dishes. Another alternative is to try and cook it by yourself, there are multiple cookbooks and online resources with Iranian cuisine recipes that you can find.

It is also important to note that sanctions and regulations are subject to change, and I would advise you to check the latest information from the relevant authorities, such as the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) before attempting to import food items from Iran.

Fat itself isn't inherently dangerous. In fact, fat makes up things that are quite important: boobs, butts, etc. Not having any fat is a bad thing. However, having too much fat is also a bad thing. posts.com:
Sushi: While sushi can be delicious when done well, it is often overpriced and not as flavorful as people think.

Tacos: Tacos are generally a hit with people, and there are so many varieties that everyone can find something they like.

Ramen: Ramen is a quick, easy and cheap meal, but it’s also often high in sodium and calories.

Pho: Pho is a great way to eat a lot of vegetables and get a good amount of protein, but it can also be high in calories and carbohydrates.

Dim Sum: Dim sum can be delicious, with the wide variety of dumplings, buns, and other dishes. However, it can be expensive and the quality can vary widely.

Pizza: Pizza is an often-loved food and is great for sharing. While it can be greasy and unhealthy, it can also be made with healthier ingredients.

Pasta: Pasta is a great comfort food and can be made in a variety of ways. While it’s often seen as a “filler” food, it can also be a delicious dish when made with quality ingredients.

You'll find that coffee brands that offer the same coffee in both pre-ground and unground forms will sell the coffee at the same price. Coffee that only comes pre-ground is always inferior coffee. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>18796748
>odds are never in your favor
You're a retard. The house edge from roulette doesn't come from the odds, it comes from the bets. If you bet on two thirds of the board, then the odds are in your favor (63% of winning each roll). The house edge comes from repeated losses, because you bet more than what the casino pays out.

With that being the case, roulette can be in the player's favor, provided they can play long enough. Martingale got away with it because casinos were new and didn't think to put bet limits, so he was able to clean house. Nowadays casinos limit what you can bet, so you can't literally bankrupt anymore like back in the day, but provided you bet proportionally with small bets and a large bankroll, you can consistently make a profit as long as their limits aren't ridiculously low.
